name: Delve
description: A global platform for artisanal and small-scale mining data, knowledge products and professionals

SDGs.evidenceText:
The Delve platform seeks to recognize the artisanal and small-scale mining sector as an important contributor to global development. The sector itself employs an estimated 44+ million individuals around the world in over 70 countries (https://delvedatabase.org/data) making significant contributions to global mineral supply chains (20% of all gold, 20% of diamonds, 25% of cobalt, 80% of sapphires: Source: https://delvedatabase.org/resources/global-trends-in-artisanal-and-small-scale-mining-asm-a-review-of-key-numbers-and-issues). The artisanal and small-scale mining sector has been linked to all 17 SDGs in a recent publication "Mapping Artisanal and Small-Scale Mining to the Sustainable Development Goals" (https://delvedatabase.org/resources/mapping-artisanal-and-small-scale-mining-to-the-sustainable-development-goals). 
Historically the sector has faced a persistent "data gap" that has obscured its contribution to global development and marginalized the sector's from the global development agenda and from policymakers. (See Delve State of the ASM Sector report 2019 https://delvedatabase.org/resources/state-of-the-artisanal-and-small-scale-mining-sector) 
The Delve platform's key aim is to demonstrate how support for and formalization of ASM activities can help fulfill the SDGs. By providing an accessible online platform for data collection and knowledge sharing and encouraging collaboration and contributions from the network of practitioners, Delve aims to provide a framework and impetus necessary for monitoring progress and to help ensure that the sector is recognized for its contributions to the SDGs. The platform has over 300 users, 700+ resources, 24 country dashboards showcasing ASM data, knowledge products and networks (https://delvedatabase.org/data, https://delvedatabase.org/resources, https://delvedatabase.org/people). The platform also has developed and coordinated a global data collection initiative across 22 countries to publish data on the impacts of COVID-19 among ASM communities (https://delvedatabase.org/covid-data). 2 State of the ASM Sector reports (2019, 2020) leveraging contributions from over 30 different institutions to demonstrate the sector's linkages to the SDGs and profile the positive examples of formalization taking place in the sector.
